'''David Cantor''' (known as '''David "Tankboy" Cantor''') is an American [[flow arts]] practitioner who co-authored the [[Vulcan Tech Gospel]] Volume 2 with [[Noel Yee]]. He taught tech [[poi]] at the [[Vulcan Lofts]] in Oakland, California.

Cantor defined VTG as "a treatise on technical prop manipulation, that seeks to explain the entirety of sets of technique using a predetermined set of constants and variables."<ref name="vtg-explained">{{cite web |url=https://drexfactor.com/weirdscience/2015/11/25/vulcan_tech_gospel_vtg_explained |title=Vulcan Tech Gospel (VTG) Explained |date=2015-11-25}}</ref>

He also contributed to the [[Book of P.H.A.T.]] by [[Lorq Nichols]].<ref name="phat">{{cite web |url=https://sirlorq.wordpress.com/tech-tiles/ |title=Vulcan Tech Gospel Book of P.H.A.T. Volume 1 |publisher=Sir Lorq}}</ref>
